intro: Orthocarpus bracteosus, commonly known as the bracteose orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is known for its distinctive bracteate structure on its flower clusters. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
